availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Horace Newton Congar (Newark, New Jersey, attorney and US commissioner of immigration )

body.p: Newark, Essex County, New Jersey, attorney, politician, and commissioner of immigration. Newark, New Jersey, native. Married to Isabell H. Reeves Congar. Father of Ella Congar and Horace Congar Jr. School teacher in Newark, New Jersey. Admitted to New Jersey state bar in 1847. Attorney in Newark, New Jersey, from 1847 to 1860. Founding member of the Free Soil Party in New Jersey. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in Buffalo, New York, in 1848. Editor of Newark Daily Mercury nin Newark, New Jersey, from 1850 to 1860. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, in 1860. U.S. consular to Hong Kong from 1860 to 1865. U.S. commissioner of immigration for the Bureau of Immigration from 1865 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark, p. 366.
